intro: Adenia aculeata subsp. inermis, commonly known as the soft-stemmed adenia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the family Passifloraceae and is characterized by its soft, non-woody stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests or understoreys. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture, while its flowers are followed by distinctive, fleshy fruits. This subspecies is notable for its lack of thorns, distinguishing it from other members of the Adenia genus.
